title: Nem nyitja meg a linkeket a böngésző
content: A legutóbbi frissítés óta, nem nyitja meg a linkeket a böngésző. Az előző frissítékor pedig a messenger üzeneteket nem tudta kezelni, az néhány nap múlva érkező frissítéssel megoldódott. De meglehetősen bosszantó, hogy az utóbbi időben egyre több probléma adódik a frissítések után.
creator: l.kovacs.andrea

creator: arejfour

title: (Urgent) Can't log in to my Developer Account
content:
I added 2FA to my account on 10 October 2021, and recently bought a new phone with a fresh Authenticator app. I have all my backup codes saved already so I thought it wouldn't be any worries. I was wrong, I've been facing this error for all the 10 different codes: Backup authentication code not found

I only have one Firefox account with 2FA, so I'm 100% confident this is the right account. I checked the email associated with the locked out Firefox account and I can see the email mentioning that I activated 2FA on 10 October 2021, and there are no emails beyond that regarding my 2FA.

Again, this is not a mistake on my end - the codes simply do not work. I've tried in different browsers. I have tried to get in contact with anyone for two weeks now, and I urgently need to upload an update to my app.

Can someone point me in the right direction? I've reached out by Twitter as well - but no reply.

Help really appreciated, Tomas
creator: tompatomp

content: How can I get rid of this (waste of space) tab - see photo marked w/ an "x"?? It hadn't been there but FF got screwed up & after a long battle got it back to almost as it was except for this issue & why now dark there isn't on toolbar/menu bar area.
creator: piikea

title: How do you remove address bar suggestions, specifically that appear *before* you start typing something?
content:
I found that you can hold shift+delete, or hover over *search* suggestions and click the "..." to remove suggestions, but for the list of suggestions that appear when you simply click on the address bar to make it active, neither of these work and there doesn't seem to be anywhere in the settings that allow you to manually remove items from this list. There was a website that I visited very frequently over the last 1-2 years, that I do not need to visit pretty much ever again, it's at the very top of the suggestions every time I click the address bar even though I haven't visitted the website in months. There are other websites in there that I don't want, even if I do still visit them, I don't necessarily want or need them to be suggested. The only way I have found is to go into my history, search the domain name, and delete all traces of the website from my all-time history. This worked for the first website I mentioned, but I don't want to have to delete my history for each website I don't want in my suggestions. Long-term history can be extremely useful. Plus it's just a super janky way of doing something very basic that should be as simple as "Right click > Delete suggestion", especially as that already exists for search suggestions. Is there an obscure or hidden way of doing this that I may be missing?

When I found the shift+del method and the "..." method I spent a good 10 minutes not understanding why it wasn't working, thinking my FF was outdated as apparently these were added in version 113, but I am on 114 so that didn't make sense. It was only after a while that I discovered that search suggestions are apparently handled separately from the default suggestions shown when you simply click on the address bar. This doesn't seem all that streamlined, so I guess as a bonus feature suggestion: make it so that the same method applies to both types of suggestions? I assume feature suggestions don't go here so I might make an actual suggestion later...

Thanks.
creator: deorgegowns

title: Pressing Enter In Dialog Box Not Working
content: Hi, I've been having a problem for the past few weeks. When I download a file, or print a page to a PDF, the dialog box to save it comes up fine...but when I hit ENTER to actually save the file, it highlights the text (name of the file) and doesn't save. I have to manually reach for my mouse and click the "Save" button on the dialog box (which works fine). Is there any way to fix this? BTW...I'm running Windows 11 (the most updated version) and my machine is a Lenovo Legion 5. My Firefox browser is also up-to-date. Thanks!
creator: Pooh_Bear

title: Restore profile

I have the "Old FF Data" folder but following the steps it doesn't show where profile is stored for me to be able to copy the old data TO. IF I can restore the old profile hopefully that would get it back working ALL as it was...but HOW??
